trial_identification.studytitle: Comparative Study on Group Therapy for Generalised Anxiety Disorder
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised study to compare the effectiveness of three forms of group therapy for the treatment of generalised anxiety disorder. Outcomes measured are changes in symptoms and psychological processes commonly associated with GAD.

interventions.interventions: Participants are randomly assigned to one of three forms of group psychotherapy: cognitive behaviour therapy, emotion focused therapy, or psychodynamic therapy. Each group therapy has a dosage of a 2 hour session each week for 9 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Self report measure: State-Trait Anxiety Inventory Depression Anxiety Stress Scale (DASS)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at pre-therapy, post-therapy and 6 month follow-up

primaryOutcome.outcome: Self report measure: Penn State Worry Scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at pre-therapy, post-therapy and 6 month follow-up

primaryOutcome.outcome: Self report measure: Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS-20)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at pre-therapy, post-therapy and 6 month follow-up

primaryOutcome.outcome: Self report measure: Interpersonal sensitivity index
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at pre-therapy, post-therapy and 6 month follow-up

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Criteria DSM IV diagnosis of Generalised Anxiety Disorder.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Poor English language abilitiesCognitive deficits (intellectual disability, dementia, delirium, significant head injury)Psychotic illnessDisclosure of risk of harm to self or others.

trial_design.sequence: sequence generated by roll of dice
